sections.title: What is SmartAdd?
sections.description: Introduction to SmartAdd and its benefits

content.content: SmartAdd is a web-based companion for Chemotion that helps researchers import, organize, and prepare chemical data before sending it into Chemotion. Instead of wrestling with complex file structures or scattered files, SmartAdd gives you a clear, visual tree view to curate your collection.
Before SmartAdd: Hours spent organizing scattered files, manual entry of sample/reaction information, steep learning curve for new users, higher risk of errors during import.
With SmartAdd: Drag & drop your files, organized in minutes, tree view clearly shows collection structure, inline editing of samples, reactions, and analyses, export-ready data for Chemotion.
Requirements: A modern browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge), analytical data files or ZIP archives of your datasets. No installation required.

First Upload: Open SmartAdd in your browser, drag & drop analytical files or a ZIP into the upload area, SmartAdd processes the files and shows them as a tree in the right-side workspace. The system automatically organizes your data with smart folder naming and structure validation.

sections.title: Step-by-Step Workflow
sections.description: Complete workflow from upload to export

content.content: Step 1: Upload Data - Prepare a ZIP (recommended) or drag individual analytical files, include related spectra/logs/metadata.

Step 2: Explore & Prepare (Right-Side Tree View) - Review how SmartAdd structured your collection. Typical hierarchy: Samples â†’ Reactions â†’ Analyses / Files. Select a node to edit properties in the editor.

items: Sample: name, SMILES notation (with real-time validation), amount + units (mg, g, mol), purity, location, description, sample type
Reaction: multiple samples with smart sorting, roles (reactant/product/solvent), reaction scheme type, RF value
Analysis: Type Ontology, file attachments, status, description, dataset inclusion/exclusion

content.content: Step 3: Organize Reactions - Click Add Reaction to create a reaction node. You can add multiple samples to reactions with automatic smart sorting. Set sample roles (reactant/product/solvent) and define reaction scheme types for proper organization.
Step 4: Export for Chemotion - Review: ensure you haven't missed anything you need and relationships correct. You now have two export options:

faq.question: What browsers are supported?
faq.answer: SmartAdd works on all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. No installation is required.

faq.question: What file formats can I upload?
faq.answer: You can upload analytical data files, ZIP archives containing your datasets, and MOL files. ZIP format is recommended for organized collections.

faq.question: How do I organize my data before uploading?
faq.answer: Keep folders logical before zipping, use clear filenames (avoid special characters), and include all related data like spectra, logs, and metadata.

faq.question: Can I edit sample and reaction properties?
faq.answer: Yes! Select any node in the tree view to edit its properties. Common fields include sample names, amounts with units, purity, reaction roles, and analysis techniques.

faq.question: How do I export my data for Chemotion?
faq.answer: After preparing your data, click Export Collection. You have two options: (1) Download as ZIP - saves the file locally for manual upload to Chemotion, or (2) Direct Upload to Chemotion - authenticate with your Chemotion ELN server and upload directly without manual download.

faq.question: What keyboard shortcuts are available?
faq.answer: Arrow keys: Navigate the tree, Enter: Expand/collapse, Tab: Move between editor fields, Ctrl/âŒ˜+S: Export, Esc: Clear selection.

faq.question: Where can I get help?
faq.answer: Use the built-in FAQ, contact support, submit feedback and feature requests, or check out our tutorials and documentation.

faq.question: What's coming next for SmartAdd?
faq.answer: Upcoming features include tree view enhancements (filters/search), advanced batch operations, import from other ELNs, enhanced validation tools, and extensions beyond chemistry to other research domains.

faq.question: What is SMILES validation?
faq.answer: SmartAdd includes real-time SMILES (Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System) validation. When entering molecular structures using SMILES notation, the system validates the syntax and structure to ensure accuracy before export.

faq.question: Can I add multiple samples to a reaction?
faq.answer: Yes! You can add multiple samples to reactions with automatic smart sorting. The system intelligently organizes samples based on their roles (reactant/product/solvent) and allows you to define reaction scheme types for proper visualization in Chemotion.

faq.question: How does direct upload to Chemotion work?
faq.answer: When you choose 'Upload to Chemotion ELN' from the export menu, you'll be prompted to enter your Chemotion server URL, username, and password. The system verifies server connectivity and authenticates your credentials before uploading your collection directly, eliminating the need for manual file downloads and imports.
